result.execSummary:
The defendant Trequis L Fields was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence.  Straight time.  If revoked, no huber privileges.

miscConds.notes: Pay all mandatory costs and surcharegs during period of probation. Bail to apply, $75.00  from case 14CM497 to be applied to this case.  Any remaining balance at the end of probation will be due immediately or an entry of a civil judgment.
Obtain and maintain employment or actively seek employment.

Maintain absolute sobriety.  
Not to possess or use any controlled substances unless by valid prescription.
No firearms, dangerous weapons.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Trequis L Fields

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1 AS ORALLY AMENDED:  Defendant sentenced to serve 90 days (STRAIGHT TIME) in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 5 (five) days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of
 one year. If revoked, no Huber privileges.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
     *   Maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant NOT possess or
          use any controlled substances unless by valid prescription.
     *   Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges during the period of probation, cash bail to apply. $75.00 of cash bail from case #14CM497 to be applied to this case.
          Any remaining balance at the end of probation will be due immediately or an entry of
          a civil judgment.
     *   Obtain and maintain employment or actively seek employment.
     *   Successfully complete 25 hours of community
          service.
     *   No firearms; dangerous weapons.
     *   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
 Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Rights and Pretrial Incarceration Credit, received and filed.
On motion of the State, Court ordered charge orally amended to Disorderly Conduct, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 947.01(1), a Class Misdemeanor B.

Defendant Trequis L Fields in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.  Case calendared for plea/sentencing hearing.
Court lifted previously stayed bench warrant.

AS TO COUNT 1 AS ORALLY AMENDED:  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.
Justice Point Program Report dated September 14, 2015; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
Justice Point Program violation report; received and filed. Court and state reviewed violation and no action at this time.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: TC. For reasons stated on the record,   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next scheduled hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Program report dated August 7, 2015; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defendant Trequis L Fields in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Justice Point Program violation report; received and filed. Court reviewed violation and would like to take action. Awaiting response from defense attorney to set bail-bond hearing.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defendant Trequis L Fields in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for projected guilty plea. Court is in jury trial for today's proceedings.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
